column4: i installed nvidia-glx while trying to enable the driver it says Error: your X configuration has been altered.
This script cannot proceed automatically. If you believe that this
not correct, you can update the md5sum entry executing the following
command:
md5sum /etc/X11/xorg.conf | sudo tee /var/lib/x11/xorg.conf.md5sum
otherwise edit manually /etc/X11/xorg.conf to change the Driver section
from nv to nvidia.
can anyone help me with it?
Do you have an entry in the /etc/X11/xorg.conf file for "nv"??
yeah
Driver  "nv"
make yourself a copy of the xorg.conf to xorg.conf it blows up first...then change the nc to nvidia.
can you help me with it?
sorry Im a little lost with the multiple conversations... re-state your issue again...
i installed nvidia-glx when i want to enable it i get Error: your X configuration has been altered.
i changed it to nv still get same error
Id try this..and see what happens....copy xorg.conf to xorg.conf.old then change the nv to nvidia.. in the file and try again..
i've tried it but same error
and reloading the X by doing a ctrl-alt-bkspc does nothing??
didn't work
i had to reboot to get out of it
that is weird....Id try and work through the entire NV how to step by step again...and see what is going on..without tracing your steps...Im not too sure what is missing.

frankly what i did is the following: i installed before nvidia-glx-legancy and it was working fine but i read in how to install nvidia is that nvidia-glx is the driver for my fx 5500 so what i did is that i removed the previous one and installed the new one so the problem occured
